name: Risk factor for standardised approach
description: Risk factor for standardised approach is a set of variables (eg an equity price or a tenor of an interest rate curve) that affect the value of an instrument as defined in MAR21.8 to MAR21.14. (https://www.bis.org/basel_framework/chapter/MAR/21.htm?inforce=20230101&published=20200327#paragraph_MAR_21_20230101_21_8)
